passageTitle: Voyage of Going: beyond the blue line 2

passageText.A: One feels a certain sympathy for Captain James Cook on the day in 1778 that he “discovered” Hawaii... (truncated for brevity in reasoning, full text will be included below).
passageText.B: Answers have been slow in coming. But now a startling archaeological find on the island of Éfaté...
passageText.C: “What we have is a first- or second-generation site containing the graves of some of the Pacific’s first explorers,” says Spriggs...
passageText.D: Within the span of few centuries the Lapita stretched the boundaries of their world...
passageText.E: What little is known or surmised about them has been pieced together from fragments...
passageText.F: Several lines of evidence also undergird Spriggs’s conclusion that this was a community...
passageText.G: “There is one stubborn question for which archaeology has yet to provide any answers...
passageText.H: The Lapita’s thrust into the Pacific was eastward, against the prevailing trade winds...
passageText.I: However they did it, the Lapita spread themselves a third of the way across the Pacific...
